text:
Name: Mrs. Hulda Hodgson
Address: Roblin Road, Sask.
Birthplace: Sweden

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONNAIRE
   What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1913
   Where did you set up housekeeping? Near a hatchery, log stock.
   Where had you been living before that? Winnipeg, Manitoba, N.D.S.
   For how many people did you prepare meals? Five
   How far was it to your nearest store? 6.2 miles
   How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice in winter, once in spring.
   What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
   mainly flour, sugar, coffee, tea, oatmeal & dried fruits.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
   What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Purity
   In what quantities did you buy it? 5 lbs. at a time
   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.90
   How much did you use Graham flour? ...........................................
   Whole wheat flour? ...............................................................
   Was flour milled locally? No... How far away? 60 miles... What year? ......
   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $1.25
   What other grain products did you use? ........................................
   Cornmeal? ................................ Whole wheat? ................................
   Oats? .......................................................... Farina? .....................
   Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
   How did you grind it? By hand coffee grinder
1913

Nordgren, Mrs. Hulda
Robinwood, Sask.

1. INTERMEDIATE HISTORY

What year did you start school in Eastern Canada?
Where did you set up housekeeping?
How many people did you prepare meals?
For how many people did you prepare meals?
How far was it to your nearest store?
How often would a visit be made to the store?
What groceries did you usually buy in those earlier years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of flour did you use in the early years?
In what quantities did you buy it?
Was this the usual rate per hundred pounds of white flour?
How much did you use per meal?
What kind of flour?
Was flour milled locally?
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of milled flour?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal?
Oats?
Did you raise your own wheat for porridge?
Did you raise your own coffee?
For did you grind it?
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? ... 10 lbs.

What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? ... 60¢

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? ... Rogers

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? ... 20 oz.

At what price? ... 85¢

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? ... Bought skim milk from a neighbor at 1¢ per quart.

Butter? ... None

Eggs? ... None

What was the price of butter? ... 2¢ per lb.

Did you pack eggs for winter? ... Yes

How? ... Water glass

Did you make butter? ... Yes

Cheese? ... Yes

What kind of cheese? ... Whole milk cheese

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? ... Beef

Rabbit, Cartridges & muskrat meat

How did you get fresh meat? ... With a gun

How often did you get fresh meat?

How did you preserve meat? ... Brine & dry salted

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? ... No

If so what year was it organized?

Did you use game? ... Yes

What kinds? ... Wild fowl & deer

For how long? ... The first year

What part did fish play in the family diet? ... Plenty in winter about 30 percent

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? ... Fresh & canned

Kinds? ... White fish mostly
5. BEVERAGES

What kind of tea did you buy? 5 cups. At what price? .............
What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) Beans. Price? 25¢ per lb. What other beverages were used? Coffee.

7. VEGETABLES AND DRIED FRUITS

What was the price of potatoes per bushel when you set up housekeeping? .............
Could you get potatoes at the store? Yes.
If not, where from? North Battleford, nearest town 40 miles away.
What year did you first grow your own supply for the winter of: 1911
Potatoes ......... Cabbages ......... Carrots ......... Onions ......... Turnips ......... Beets ......... In what quantities did you buy white navy beans? 25 lbs. bulk.
How did you buy prunes, (in bulk or by the box)? Box.
What weight? 20 lbs. How did the grocer handle prunes (by box)? Yes.
What was the price of prunes? .............
What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (apples, pears, apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currants or others)? Apples, Raisins.

8. PRESERVING

In the early years did you preserve any foods by drying? .............
Peas? Yes. Corn? Beans? Saskatoons? Yes.
Other foods? Rhubarb.
What year did you first preserve fruit by canning? 1918.
What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? 1928.
What year did you first preserve meat by canning? 1929.
Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? Yes.
To what extent? A year's supply.
Did you make your own vinegar? No.
6. What kind of tea did you buy? (Tea or coffee) ... Black tea

7. How much coffee did you buy? (Tea or coffee) ... 25 lbs.

8. In what quantity did you buy shiitake navy beans? ... 10 lbs.

9. How did you buy peaches? (In bulk or by the box)? ... By the box

10. What was the variety of peaches? ... Red Delicious

11. What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (Apples, pears, apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currants or others?) ... Raisins

12. In what quantity did you buy nuts by lb./in.? ... 10 lbs.

13. What year did you first preserve fruit by canning? ... 1918

14. What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? ... 1928

15. Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? ... Yes

16. Learning any other? ... No

| Incaroni              |                                               |                                                   |                            |                     |

| Baking powder         |                                               |                                                   |                            |                     |

| Vinegar               |                                               |                                                   |                            |                     |

| Cheese (Cheddar or store cheese) | | | | |
| Vanilla               |                                               |                                                   |                            |                     |

10. BAKING

What type of yeast did you use? Royal

Did you make yeast for your own use? Using starter?

Using hops? Salt rising?

Did you buy baking powder? yes

Did you buy cream of tartar? yes

Did you make your own baking powder? no

| Food                        | Earliest date it appeared on the market | Approximate price at the time | Does it differ from the same product today? |

| Walnuts                     |                                        |                               |                                            |
| Icing sugar                 |                                        |                               |                                            |

12. WATER SUPPLY

Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, slough, dugout) ... well, pulled up by pail & rope.

How far was this water from your home? ...........................................

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) ... pail ....................

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.
### II. PLANT FOODS

| Item                  | Amount Used | Approximate Price |
|-----------------------|-------------|-------------------|
| Corn meal             |             |                   |
| Cassava               |             |                   |
| Other cereal          |             |                   |
| Fish or fish meal     |             |                   |
| Fruits                |             |                   |
| Vegetables            |             |                   |
| Legumes               |             |                   |
| Beans                 |             |                   |
| Peanuts               |             |                   |
| Other vegetables      |             |                   |

### III. WATER SUPPLY

12. Water supply:
   - Did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (small river, slough, dugout) **Dugout**
   - If so, how was this water from your house? **Pulled up by pump.**
   - How was it brought to the house? (pail, barrel, tank) **Pail.**

For adding water supply mention any changes which have taken place since you first started homesteading, giving dates where possible.
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? ...........................................
If you made your own, did you use lye? .............................................. wood ashes? ...............
What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle? ...........................................

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? ...........................................
Where did you get your fuel? ...........................................
......................................................................................................................

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) ........................................................................................................
Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) ........................

By whom was your first cook stove made? ...........................................
What year was it purchased? .............................................. Price? .......................
What types of utensils did you use? (Iron, copper, tin, homemade) .............
......................................................................................................................

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other) ...............
......................................................................................................................

When did you first see enamel ware? ...........................................
Aluminum? ...........................................

_____________________________________________________________________

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS

16. **UNPACKING AND CONTAINERS**

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

---

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

- **Breakfast:** oatmeal pancakes & coffee
- **Dinner:** meat potatoes & beans or dried apples tea
- **Supper:** the same as dinner

---

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? .................. Give the name. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

---

19. Have you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

   year. Note the date and list the names of the family members.

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homemade and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].
